questions.text: Which set of conditions is indicated with Evisceration?

options.label: A
options.text: Endophthalmitis, Penetration ocular trauma, Intraocular malignancy.

options.label: B
options.text: Expulsive choroidal hemorrhage, bleeding ant. Staphyloma, phthisis bulbi.

options.label: D
options.text: Endophthalmitis, Penetration ocular trauma, Expulsive choroidal hemorrhage.

questions.correct_answer: D. Endophthalmitis, Penetration ocular trauma, Expulsive choroidal hemorrhage.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Endophthalmitis, Penetration ocular trauma, Expulsive choroidal hemorrhage. It is the removal of the contents of the eyeball leaving behind the sclera . Frill evisceration is preferred over simple evisceration . In it, only about a 3-mm frill of the sclera is left around the optic nerve. Evisceration Removal of the contents of the eye, while maintaining an intact scleral shell attached to the extraocular muscles Exenteration Removal of the globe along with all the soft tissues of the orbit, eyeball, fat, muscles Enucleation Removal of the eyeball, but the adjacent structures of the eye socket and eyelids remain Advantages of Evisceration over Enucleation Shorter operative time More cost efficient A technically simpler procedure A less invasive procedure (important in cases when GA is contraindicated or in bleeding disorders) Less disruption of orbital tissues chance of injury to EOM,nerves and fat atrophy reduced Relationships between the muscles, globe, eyelids, and fornices remain undisturbed Less chance of spread of infection to nervous system Indications . These include: Panophthalmitis, Endophthalmitis Penetrating ocular trauma Blind, painful eye Expulsive choroidal hemorrhage Bleeding anterior staphyloma

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Endophthalmitis, Penetration ocular trauma, Intraocular malignancy - panophthalmitis is the correct indication. Option: B. Expulsive choroidal hemorrhage, bleeding ant. Staphyloma, phthisis bulbi - phthisis bulbi is not included. Option: C. Endophthalmitis, bleeding ant. Staphyloma, micro-ophthalmia - micro ophthalmia is not included.

questions.text: Which of the following are the absolute indications of Enucleation?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Retinoblastoma, Malignant Melanoma. Evisceration Removal of the contents of the eye, while maintaining an intact scleral shell attached to the extraocular muscles Exenteration Removal of the globe along with all the soft tissues of the orbit, eyeball, fat, muscles Enucleation Removal of the eyeball, but the adjacent structures of the eye socket and eyelids remain Indications of enucleation . Absolute indications are: Retinoblastoma Malignant melanoma. Relative indications are: Painful blind eye due to absolute glaucoma. Painful blind eye due to endophthalmitis.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. Mutilating ocular injury, Phthisis bulbi: Relative indications. Option: C. Retinoblastoma, Phthisis bulbi : Phthisis bulbi is a relative indication. Option: D. Malignant melanoma, Mutilating ocular injury: Mutilating ocular injury is a relative indication.
